low.desc: Indicates the upper bound of the lower range.

csp.desc:
This is an experimental API that should not be used in production code.
Specifies the Content Security Policy that an embedded document must agree to enforce upon itself.

readonly.desc: Indicates whether the element can be edited.

selected.desc: Defines a value which will be selected on page load.

lang.desc: Defines the language used in the element.

loop.desc: Indicates whether the media should start playing from the start when it's finished.

autofocus.desc: The element should be automatically focused after the page loaded.

reversed.desc: Indicates whether the list should be displayed in a descending order instead of a ascending.

width.desc:
For the elements listed here, this establishes the element's width.

    
    Note: For all other instances, such as <div>, this is a legacy attribute, in which case the CSS width property should be used instead.

autocomplete.desc: Indicates whether controls in this form can by default have their values automatically completed by the browser.

list.desc: Identifies a list of pre-defined options to suggest to the user.

align.desc: Specifies the horizontal alignment of the element.

media.desc: Specifies a hint of the media for which the linked resource was designed.

lazyload.desc:
This is an experimental API that should not be used in production code.
Indicates if the element should be loaded lazily.

high.desc: Indicates the lower bound of the upper range.

coords.desc: A set of values specifying the coordinates of the hot-spot region.

defer.desc: Indicates that the script should be executed after the page has been parsed.

translate.desc: Specify whether an element’s attribute values and the values of its Text node children are to be translated when the page is localized, or whether to leave them unchanged.

ismap.desc: Indicates that the image is part of a server-side image map.

height.desc:
Specifies the height of elements listed here. For all other elements, use the CSS height property.

    
    Note: In some instances, such as <div>, this is a legacy attribute, in which case the CSS height property should be used instead.

dropzone.desc: Indicates that the element accept the dropping of content on it.

muted.desc: Indicates whether the audio will be initially silenced on page load.

class.desc: Often used with CSS to style elements with common properties.

autoplay.desc: The audio or video should play as soon as possible.

slot.desc: Assigns a slot in a shadow DOM shadow tree to an element.

download.desc: Indicates that the hyperlink is to be used for downloading a resource.

srcset.desc: One or more responsive image candidates.

placeholder.desc: Provides a hint to the user of what can be entered in the field.

label.desc: Specifies a user-readable title of the text track.

method.desc: Defines which HTTP method to use when submitting the form. Can be GET (default) or POST.

form.desc: Indicates the form that is the owner of the element.

border.desc:
The border width.

    
    Note: This is a legacy attribute. Please use the CSS border property instead.

minlength.desc: Defines the minimum number of characters allowed in the element.

id.desc: Often used with CSS to style a specific element. The value of this attribute must be unique.

for.desc: Describes elements which belongs to this one.

buffered.desc: Contains the time range of already buffered media.

hreflang.desc: Specifies the language of the linked resource.

enctype.desc: Defines the content type of the form date when the method is POST.

colspan.desc: The colspan attribute defines the number of columns a cell should span.

src.desc: The URL of the embeddable content.

async.desc: Indicates that the script should be executed asynchronously.

wrap.desc: Indicates whether the text should be wrapped.

integrity.desc: Security Feature that allows browsers to verify what they fetch.

allow.desc: Specifies a feature-policy for the iframe.

cite.desc: Contains a URI which points to the source of the quote or change.

href.desc: The URL of a linked resource.

name.desc: Name of the element. For example used by the server to identify the fields in form submits.

challenge.desc: A challenge string that is submitted along with the public key.

style.desc: Defines CSS styles which will override styles previously set.

value.desc: Defines a default value which will be displayed in the element on page load.

preload.desc: Indicates whether the whole resource, parts of it or nothing should be preloaded.

accept.desc: List of types the server accepts, typically a file type.

start.desc: Defines the first number if other than 1.

alt.desc: Alternative text in case an image can't be displayed.

codebase.desc: This attribute gives the absolute or relative URL of the directory where applets' .class files referenced by the code attribute are stored.

scope.desc: Defines the cells that the header test (defined in the th element) relates to.

action.desc: The URI of a program that processes the information submitted via the form.

rowspan.desc: Defines the number of rows a table cell should span over.

content.desc: A value associated with http-equiv or name depending on the context.

dir.desc: Defines the text direction. Allowed values are ltr (Left-To-Right) or rtl (Right-To-Left)

crossorigin.desc: How the element handles cross-origin requests

contextmenu.desc: Defines the ID of a <menu> element which will serve as the element's context menu.

draggable.desc: Defines whether the element can be dragged.

autocapitalize.desc: Controls whether and how text input is automatically capitalized as it is entered/edited by the user.

datetime.desc: Indicates the date and time associated with the element.

decoding.desc: Indicates the preferred method to decode the image.

kind.desc: Specifies the kind of text track.

title.desc: Text to be displayed in a tooltip when hovering over the element.

contenteditable.desc: Indicates whether the element's content is editable.

required.desc: Indicates whether this element is required to fill out or not.

maxlength.desc: Defines the maximum number of characters allowed in the element.

rel.desc: Specifies the relationship of the target object to the link object.

pattern.desc: Defines a regular expression which the element's value will be validated against.

type.desc: Defines the type of the element.

cols.desc: Defines the number of columns in a textarea.

accesskey.desc: Defines a keyboard shortcut to activate or add focus to the element.

poster.desc: A URL indicating a poster frame to show until the user plays or seeks.

bgcolor.desc:
Background color of the element.

    
    Note: This is a legacy attribute. Please use the CSS background-color property instead.

controls.desc: Indicates whether the browser should show playback controls to the user.

hidden.desc: Prevents rendering of given element, while keeping child elements, e.g. script elements, active.

manifest.desc: Specifies the URL of the document's cache manifest.

sandbox.desc: Stops a document loaded in an iframe from using certain features (such as submitting forms or opening new windows).

size.desc: Defines the width of the element (in pixels). If the element's type attribute is text or password then it's the number of characters.

rows.desc: Defines the number of rows in a text area.

formaction.desc: Indicates the action of the element, overriding the action defined in the <form>.

data-*.desc: Lets you attach custom attributes to an HTML element.

novalidate.desc: This attribute indicates that the form shouldn't be validated when submitted.

language.desc: Defines the script language used in the element.

open.desc: Indicates whether the details will be shown on page load.

disabled.desc: Indicates whether the user can interact with the element.

data.desc: Specifies the URL of the resource.

spellcheck.desc: Indicates whether spell checking is allowed for the element.

referrerpolicy.desc: Specifies which referrer is sent when fetching the resource.

charset.desc: Declares the character encoding of the page or script.

color.desc:
This attribute sets the text color using either a named color or a color specified in the hexadecimal #RRGGBB format.

    
    Note: This is a legacy attribute. Please use the CSS color property instead.

default.desc: Indicates that the track should be enabled unless the user's preferences indicate something different.

checked.desc: Indicates whether the element should be checked on page load.

keytype.desc: Specifies the type of key generated.

code.desc: Specifies the URL of the applet's class file to be loaded and executed.

importance.desc:
This is an experimental API that should not be used in production code.
Indicates the relative fetch priority for the resource.

multiple.desc: Indicates whether multiple values can be entered in an input of the type email or file.

tabindex.desc: Overrides the browser's default tab order and follows the one specified instead.

icon.desc: Specifies a picture which represents the command.

headers.desc: IDs of the <th> elements which applies to this element.
